phrases: I figured if they could not become pro after this,
there is something seriously wrong with this world.
Blinking eyes call the wind
A smile clears all the noise away
The angel in your eyes whispers
Everything begins now
Can you feel it now Can you feel it now
It is like being caught in a wave
Pulling on my heart Pulling on my heart
Breath held, arms reaching out
Baby this world is different from yesterday's
You are the only one I can see
Baby my wish on a wing
This sky is torn
By a single overflowing word
That day was BLAST's third time on the stage in the big city.
It was at the same venue as usual.
They were the opening act and played for 40 minutes.
BLAST is really popular!
The line was all the way to the convenience store.
Misato told me excitedly as she returned from buying some juice.
She had passed the line of people waiting since before the concert hall opened,
hoping to get seats close to the front.
That was the right decision to come early.
You might want to tell Junko and Kyosuke to hurry.
But Jun-chan was a bit pissed off at the concert the other day,
being pushed around by the crowd.
She said she would watch from the back today.
Do not push!
I am dying here!
Huh?
Why?
That life risking feeling is what makes it so special!
It never gets that heated at the concerts back home.
I was so excited, I almost passed out.
Almost passed out?
It was only their third concert,
but they opened the hall earlier than scheduled because of the long line up,
and in a blink of an eye, the place was packed.
Awesome!
Awesome!
Awesome!
Jun-chan and Kyosuke might not be able to get in.
What?!
Tickets are sold out?!
Wow.
Incredible.
We are all standing anyway.
Cannot you squeeze in just two more?
But we are already way past capacity.
I beg you.
Our friends are performing from seven.
You are friends?
You on the guest list?
- I do not know.
- Your names?
Saotome and Takakura.
That is fine.
Go ahead.
If you do not mind standing in the hallway way up in the back.
Hey, do you have tickets?
No.
Then give up.
The show is sold out.
- What?! - What?!
No way!
We came all the way out to Tokyo just to come to this concert!
See?
I told you we should have left earlier.
It is your fault for insisting on attending those classes!
But the teacher said he would not let me graduate high school
unless I attended those classes!
Well, that is your fault for not studying hard enough!
I beg of you, please let us in!
Impossible!
Any more people and we would be facing safety issues!
Some concert is not worth losing your life over!
- It sure is! - Like I said, it is impossible.
Nana!
Nana!
Crying is not going to help.
Listen...
Let these girls go in instead of us.
The enthusiasm of the crowd increased with each concert.
I started feeling dizzy from it.
Oh, I am sorry.
It is okay.
Excuse me.
But, thank goodness we got in, Akiko.
Fortunately, our expensive plane tickets did not go to waste.
Say, the people of Tokyo are surprisingly kind.
I wish we could get down there.
But even the stairway is packed with people, so I guess it is impossible.
But this is kind of nice.
We can see better from here, and we do not hafta risk our lives.
Anyway, what is up with all these people right from the beginning?
Impressive, do not you think?
It is because they are good.
This makes me feel lonely, in a strange way.
With this popularity, Nana may have forgotten about us.
But she is sent me a postcard to notify me
every time she has a concert coming up.
That was a good call to hand her that paper with your address on it.
You know, from next time, I say we skip school and work,
and come to all the concerts.
Even if we must hitchhike!
I agree!
Even if we need to camp out!
Now, now...
I agree!
Even if we need to camp out!
I agree!
Even if we need to camp out!
That will give us the strength to work hard with other stuff.
Exactly at seven of the clock, the starting time of the concert,
the first one to appear on stage... was Nana.
Absorbed in the cheers that got louder with each concert,
I felt that I was disappearing into the crowd.
Good evening.
We are BLAST.
Damn it, it is begun!
Hey, I can hear it.
They sure play loud!
I want to go in!
BLAST should play in a bigger place!
Do you know what the population of Tokyo is?!
We should have purchased our tickets ahead of time.
We will wait around and catch the band on their way out.
Who do you want to see?
Yasu.
He has great technique.
No way!
Yasu's mine!
I am guessing, it is summer vacation,
so many people have come out here from the suburbs,
causing this situation.
Even so, this level of enthusiasm is crazy.
What is this?
Whaddaya want to do?
Want To go for a coffee until the concert's over?
Sure.
We have come all the way here.
Let us stick around and meet up with Nana later.
But with so many followers,
they should be able to go pro without any problem.
That is it!
They are followers!
Misato's one, and Nana has a bit of that towards her roommate.
Yeah, you are right.
Maybe the reason she no longer talks about the Demon Lord
is not because she is matured,
but because she is switched over to the religion of BLAST.
Bottom line, she needs something to depend on.
Well, at least she is more positive about things now
than back when she would blame everything on the Demon Lord.
Besides, BLAST is really cool.
I can see why they have such devoted followers.
Their presence on stage is out of the ordinary.
You are right.
Especially that vocalist.
You know, I was thinking.
You know how with musicians, talent alone does not guarantee success?
Well, of course you have got to be above a certain level
if you are going to go pro.
But from that point on, it is not really about how good or bad you are.
Charisma.
GAIA RECORD CO. LTD. PRODUCER TAKAFUMI KAWANO Charisma.
GAIA RECORD CO. LTD. PRODUCER TAKAFUMI KAWANO
GAIA RECORD CO. LTD. PRODUCER TAKAFUMI KAWANO
Your band has that.
Your band has that.
Your musical performance and your songs are exceptional.
It was a wonderful show.
I have been in this business for a long time,
but I have not been so moved to this extent for ages.
There is a lot for us to discuss.
Rather than just talk things over here, why do not I...
take you out for sushi?
Yay!
Sushi!
Shin.
What?
You did not go meet them backstage?
No.
They were seeing a guy from a record company.
It would be distracting to have outsiders there while they are trying to talk business.
We will be seeing everyone at home later, anyway.
Oh, a post-live party?
Then we are going straight to your place, Nana?
Mhm...
I figured tonight will be a night to celebrate, so I prepared lots of food.
So please come.
Sorry.
We are kind of busy now.
We have got to get home right away.
Huh?
Why?
It is summer vacation.
We have a group exhibition starting next week.
Six of us have rented a gallery,
us and some friends from the Art College.
We are super busy for the exhibition.
Is that so?
A group exhibition?
Like a true art student.
I feel sorry that you could not see the concert
after coming out here during a very busy time.
It is not as bad as those who came all the way to Tokyo from a different city
and were not able to get in.
Indeed.
Here.
It is a pamphlet with information on our group exhibition.
Come by if you have time.
ART COLLEGE OIL PAINTING 2 MIYUKI AIKAWA JUNKO SAOTOME KATSUHIRO ISHIBASHI KYOSUKE TAKAKURA YOSHIHIRO KUME YUTAKA NAKASONE
ART COLLEGE OIL PAINTING 2 MIYUKI AIKAWA JUNKO SAOTOME KATSUHIRO ISHIBASHI KYOSUKE TAKAKURA YOSHIHIRO KUME YUTAKA NAKASONE
Friends studying the same thing.
Jun-chan and Kyosuke are working diligently in their own world.
I feel an even stronger sense that they are leaving me behind.
Miss Hachiko, your cell phone's ringing.
Hello, Nana here.
Oh, Nana?
Good job with the live concert.
We are back home.
We got a ride home.
What about you guys, Nana?
What time can you get here?
Sorry.
It does not look like we are going to be able to make it.
We have been invited to have dinner with the guy from Gaia.
I imagine we will be pretty late.
Did you by chance already make preparations for our post-live party?
No, not yet!
We just got home!
I am really sorry.
Not to worry.
It is okay, do not worry about us.
Go.
This waste of time happens often.
I am working tomorrow evening, but I will stop by during the day.
Oh, but I have work from the morning tomorrow.
What about Misato?
Let me talk to her for a bit.
It is Nana.
Hello?
Yes.
Nana, it was an awesome performance.
Huh?
Oh?
Is that so?
No, let us hope they bring up the subject of a contract.
Huh?
Tomorrow?
What about me?
Yes, I will be waiting for you at home.
Hey, Nana, what about me?
Nana, Mr. Kawano's called for a taxi.
Let us go.
They are waiting in the street...
Oops.
Sorry, you are on the phone.
Sorry, Misato, I have to go now.
Say bye to Hachiko for me, okay?
Huh?
Oh, go ahead.
Feel free to stay in my room.
The room's not locked.
Mhm.
Bye.
Was that Misato?
What about Hachi?
She said not to worry and go.
Misato and Hachiko should come and join us for sushi.
You idiot.
Let us go.
Idiot?
Good job.
Oh!
Nana!
I live, encouraged by the songs you sing.
DEAR NANA, I BOUGHT THE CD YOU RELEASED YOURSELVES.
IT IS THE GREATEST!
I LIVE, ENCOURAGED BY THE SONGS YOU SING.
I live, encouraged by the songs you sing.
YOUR LYRICS REALLY HIT HOME.
I WOULD LIKE FOR MORE PEOPLE TO HAVE THE CHANCE TO LISTEN TO YOU.
BUT I MAY GET LONELY IF YOU BECOME FAMOUS.
YOU KNOW HOW REN'S ALREADY BECOME REALLY POPULAR...
I live, encouraged by the songs you sing.
YOUR LYRICS REALLY HIT HOME.
I WOULD LIKE FOR MORE PEOPLE TO HAVE THE CHANCE TO LISTEN TO YOU.
BUT I MAY GET LONELY IF YOU BECOME FAMOUS.
YOU KNOW HOW REN'S ALREADY BECOME REALLY POPULAR...
It is only natural for Nana to treat Misato,
who pursues Nana with passion and
makes the effort to come all the way to Tokyo for every concert,
more importantly than she treats me.
It is only natural for Nana to place a higher priority on talks
with a record label than any promise she made with me.
And it is also only natural that
she would choose to be with Ren than live with me.
It all makes sense.
But if that is the case... she no longer needs me.
It is such a shame, Miss Hachiko.
After making all this food.
Huh?
Oh, right!
It cannot be helped, given the circumstances.
Do not feel pressured into eating more than you want, Misato.
But everything's so delicious.
It would be hard not to overeat.
You are a very good cook, Miss Hachiko.
I am impressed.
Misato is such a nice girl.
She is so much in love with Nana,
yet will never show hostile sentiments to those around her.
And she was honestly happy about Nana and Ren.
She is a really cute, good girl.
Which exhausts me all the more with my tendency to be cynical.
I wonder if we can get along for a full month.
INBOX OUTBOX DRAFTS SIGNATURE
TAKUMI
A FRIEND WILL BE STAYING WITH ME DURING SUMMER VACATION, SO DO NOT COME BY MY PLACE, OKAY?
NANA
This is like telling him that I cannot see him until summer vacation is over.
Well, I guess that is fine.
Since with him, I am never sure whether or not I will ever see him again anyway.
I ended up never seeing Nobu again as well.
And while he was on stage,
I purposely tried not to look over to him.
Nana...
This is not good.
What should I do?
I am feeling so lonely.
Is your friend a woman?
Of course!
Really?
Then that is fine.
Good night.
Yes.
Takumi,.,
I want to see you.
Oh, Miss Hachiko, thank you for letting me take a bath.
I am sorry, Misato.
I am going out for a bit.
Huh?
At this hour?
Did something happen?
No.
It is nothing important, but I will not be coming home tonight.
I will be going straight to work from there tomorrow.
I will leave my keys with you,
so leave it in the mailbox downstairs when you go out.
Sorry to leave you alone.
But I just could not make it through the night tonight.
Bye, Takumi.
I will come pick you up tomorrow morning at ten.
Do not you dare leave your room until then.
Yes.
Thank you, Take.
Drop by my place and bring me a change of clothes, okay?
Sure.
Sorry to keep you waiting, Reira.
Take.
Huh?
Get a room for me too.
I am feeling carsick.
The price on the meter is getting pretty high.
By the time I get there, it could be as high as my wages for tomorrow.
ROOM 2015 JUST SO YOU KNOW, IT IS NOT A SUITE.
THOSE ARE SPECIAL FOR FIRST AND LAST STAYS ONLY.
Which means this is not the last time, right?
Nobu, you were more popular than me tonight.
- Thank you very much, Mr. Kawano.
- I do not understand.
The meal was exceptional.
How about another drink somewhere around here?
No thank you, I have to go to work tomorrow.
Right, you are working at a law firm, right?
What are you going to do about that?
I will give it some serious thought along with this issue about our contract.
I see.
I am hoping for a positive reply.
TAXI STOP
TAXI STOP
Yasu, I am going to take a taxi with Nobu and Shin.
Yasu, I am going to take a taxi with Nobu and Shin.
Hachiko said she is working from the morning tomorrow,
so I will drop by to see her tonight.
Yeah, that would be good.
Send her my apologies for not being able to make it
to the after-party.
Mr. Kawano is such a laid-back type of man, do not you think?
At this rate, it is going to take us one hundred years before our debut.
Does a man like that really understand the likes of rock and punk?
Sure, he said that he was moved, but...
Still, he gave us money for the cab, so I am sure he is a good man.
I am not sure if that determines whether or not he is a good man.
Let us split the change.
Excuse me!
Stop here!
What is it?!
Work?
Where do you get all that energy?
Say hi to Hachi for me, Nobu.
Are you planning on coming too?
I am not.
I give up.
There are lots of women out there.
And I am pretty popular with the girls.
At least grow your hair, Nobuo.
I will get no pleasure winning her over in that department!
Actually I do not think it will look good on you.
Then do not say it!
I am back.
Sorry for waking you.
I forgot my key at my friend's place.
Ren's place?
I forgot my key at my friend's place.
Ren's place?
Ren's place?
No, it is fine.
I was still awake.
No, it is fine.
I was still awake.
What about Hachi?
Has she gone to bed?
Ah...
Miss Hachiko went out a short while ago.
Huh?
Where could she have gone at this hour?
I am not sure but she suddenly left in a flurry,
saying she would not be returning tonight.
I might have done something to upset her again.
No, it is not that.
I am sure it is a guy.
I will bet she went to see her boyfriend.
Do not worry.
Huh?
Is the beer cold?
Yes.
So, Miss Hachiko has a boyfriend?
Why?
Does it surprise you?
Yes!
Yes, she says.
Because to me, it seemed that Miss Hachiko thinks only of you, Nana.
There is no way.
But I think only of you, Nana.
Making remarks like that as if it were impossible hurts my feelings.
I am sorry.
What is this?
Oh, it is a microwave.
Well, I can tell that by looking at it, but...
She said she got a loan to buy it.
Apparently that was the only place she could put it.
If she had that kind of money, why not get an air conditioner?
Geez, that Hachi.
Say, what is with this mountain of leftovers in the fridge?
That...
Actually, Miss Hachiko figured tonight would be a night to celebrate,
and she had already prepared this before I arrived here.
Did you already make preparations for our after-party?
No, not yet.
Do not worry about us and go.
I am sorry.
No, you could not help it, Nana.
Um, so how did it go with the record company?
Hey, Nana...
For instance, if we were lovers,
would we have been able to fill the gap between us with a hug?
Or... does everyone endure this loneliness?
It is not that I wanted to keep you all to myself, Nana.
I just wanted to be needed by you.
I reached into the sky
But I could not reach what I wanted
They grew smaller and disappeared into the sky
Like colorful balloons
I am alone
My hand had no place to go
And gently you took it
Starless night
I will not look back at the shadow of my past
I want to feel your warmth
Tears are falling down
Even if I am unsure I will not let go
Of your hand holding mine
